attributes.action: intervene to ensure that there is NO SECRECY in the House of Commons in future when dealing with matters which are not covering items of national security.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Secrecy should only ever be maintained when it is a matter of national security which is being discussed by our elected representatives.  David Cameron is now saying that the vote for the new Mr Speaker should be held in secret.  WHY, we the people need to know who voted for what or for whom.  WHY should anything which is done on our behalf as routine business in the House of Commons be shrouded in secrecy.  Secrecy has been used in the past merely to avoid embarrassment for successive government failures and personal failures of elected representatives and this must be stopped.  We are paying for it, we have a right to know what is going on!

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
